channel.title: The Open Universe
channel.description: The Open Universe — an unbounded journey through the archives of astronomy. Hosted by Sownak Bose and Ana Bonaca.
channel.itunes:author: Sownak Bose and Ana Bonaca

item.itunes:title: Episode 4: The final voyage in the life of a star
item.itunes:summary: Relive the story of Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar who, as a 19-year old, came to a remarkable realization on board a ship journeying to start his physics scholarship in England. This discovery would lead to a bitter spat with one of the most eminent luminaries in the world of astronomy, and eventually reveal an astonishing feature of time and space â€“ the existence of black holes.

item.itunes:title: Episode 3: How did a 1912 circular open up our Universe?
item.itunes:summary: The vastness of space was unfathomable until a pioneer of "Big Data" found a regularity in the way some stars change brightness, a discovery which has ever since allowed us to precisely measure distances to stars throughout the Milky Way and beyond

item.itunes:title: Episode 2: The ultimate fate of the Universe
item.itunes:summary: Our universe appears to be an ever-expanding, or an open universe. Join us on a journey into the future to discover what this means for all the planets, stars, and galaxies

item.itunes:title: Episode 1: Can seismic activity on stars help us discover the next Earth?
item.itunes:summary: Discovering small planets like the Earth orbiting other stars like the Sun is hard, but blobs of gas surfacing from stellar interiors can help
